title: Garbage Plate Nutritional Analysis
body: <p>I had lost the link to <a href="http://www.379.com/jason/tahou/analysis.html">the original page</a> long ago but found it recently while googling for <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/archive/2006/01/11/irondequoit_hots_closed_no_more_hog_plates.aspx">Garbage Plate related items</a>. If my math is correct, and <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calorie">Wikipedia</a> is as well, then there are <strong>837.18 calories from fat in a Garbage Plate</strong> (93.02g fat × 9kcal/g fat = 837.18kcal). Now if we assume that the rest of the weight is protein and carbs, which are luckily both 4kcal/g, that is an additional 1976.04 calories ((587.03g total - 93.02g fat)g × 4kcal/g = 1976.04kcal). That would bring the grand total up to 2813.22 calories in a plate!. I'm guessing that I should account for the moisture since I don't think that should count towards the total amount (I'm clearly not a nutritionalist). That means I'd have to take the total weight of each item individually, subtract the percentage of moisture, subtract the weight of the fat, <em>then</em> multiply by 4kcal/g. Aw man, this is gonna require a table for me to keep track of now...</p><table><thead><tr><th>ingredient</th><th>weight in g</th><th>% water</th><th>g fat</th><th>weight - % water</th><th>remaining weight in g</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>burger</td><td>103.7</td><td>54.5</td><td>21.56</td><td>103.7 - (103.7 × 0.545) = 56.5165</td><td>56.5165 - 21.56 = 34.9565</td></tr><tr><td>mac</td><td>242.66</td><td>51.2</td><td>47.34</td><td>242.66 - (242.66 × 0.512) = 118.41808</td><td>118.41808 - 47.34 = 71.07808</td></tr><tr><td>taters</td><td>151.53</td><td>56.3</td><td>23.55</td><td>151.53 - (151.53 × 0.563) = 66.21861</td><td>66.21861 - 23.55 = 42.66861</td></tr><tr><td>bread</td><td>89.57</td><td>27.0</td><td>0.57</td><td>89.57 - (89.57 × 0.27) = 65.3861</td><td>65.3861 - 27.0 = 38.3861</td></tr><tr><th>remaining total:</th><td>187.08929g</td><th>kcal:</th><td>748.35716</td><th>total calories:</th><td>1585.53716</td></tr></tbody></table><p>1586 calories sounds pretty healthy for what you get.  So that leaves the number of calories in a Cheeseburger Garbage Plate anywhere between 1586 and 2813. Plus I would say that there is an approximate margin of error of ±50% because there are so many unknowns, I can't account for undigestables, and who knows how accurate that Cornell dude was. Regardless, chances are you'll be over your 70g/95g daily limit for fat.</p><p><strong>PLEASE NOTE:</strong> I'm not a mathematician, a nutritionalist, or a lawyer, so please check my work and correct me where I'm wrong. Thanks!</p>
bodyArticleHtml:
2006-01-11
